title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી શહેર વડોદરે, કરી જનની જીવને સાર; 
સંભળાવું સંક્ષેપશું, સહુ સુણજ્યો નરનાર્ય.
gujarati.context: In Vadodara city, one's life becomes prosperous and good; let us listen carefully and keep our words brief, just like a couple.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સામર્થિ પોત્યે શ્રીહરિ, આજ વાવરે છે અપરિમીત<RHYME_208002>; 
તે કહી ન જાય કોઈથી, છે એવી અલૌકિક રીત<RHYME_208002>.
gujarati.context: The Almighty's mercy is boundless and infinite today; it is a divine way that cannot be explained or understood by anyone.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આગે પરચા પૂરિયા, જન હેતે લઈ અવતાર<RHYME_208003>; 
પણ એહ થકી રીત્ય આજની, છે જો અપરમપાર<RHYME_208003>.
gujarati.context: The soul is taken away by the will of God and reunited with its true form; this cycle of life and death has been going on since time immemorial.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહી કહી કહીએ ક્યાં લગી, એક જીભે જશ અપાર<RHYME_208004>; 
પણ જે આવે મારી જાણ્યમાં, કરું કાંઈક તેનો ઉચ્ચાર<RHYME_208004>.
gujarati.context: The summary is: "I may not know where to find someone, but when I recognize them in my own heart, I can give them their due praise."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એક દ્વિજ ભક્ત છે દક્ષણી, કહું વાત હવે તેહ તણી; 
નારુપંત નાના તેનું નામ<RHYME_208006>, કરે રાજસમાજનું કામ<RHYME_208006>.
gujarati.context: A devout devotee from the south is now silent; his name is Narupant, doing God's work in this world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં થયો સતસંગ<RHYME_208007>, ચડ્યો ચિત્તે તેનો અતિ રંગ<RHYME_208007>; 
વળી એમ સમજ્યો સુજાણ<RHYME_208008>, મળ્યા પ્રભુ પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ<RHYME_208008>.
gujarati.context: Through good company, one's spirit is lifted and colors with intense beauty; as a result, the understanding of the universe is revealed to us, just like the Lord's grand plan.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
રહી નહિ ઉધારાની વાત<RHYME_208009>, તેણે કરી રહે રળિયાત<RHYME_208009>; 
સાચો સમજાણો સતસંગ<RHYME_208007>, ભજે શ્રીહરિ કરી ઉમંગ<RHYME_208007>.
gujarati.context: The untruthful talk that lingers doesn't last; a true friend prays to Sri Hari with pure devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે સ્વામી સહજાનંદ સત્ય<RHYME_208010>, તેહ વિના તો બીજું અસત્ય<RHYME_208010>; 
એવી અંતરમાં ગાંઠ્ય પાડી, ઊખડે નહિ કેની ઉખાડી.
gujarati.context: Truth is simple and straightforward, without it there's only falsehood. One should not get entangled in the inner workings of life, and instead just tear apart what needs to be torn apart.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં વીત્યા કાંઈ દન<RHYME_208012>, આવ્યું સંસાર સંબંધી વિઘન<RHYME_208012>; 
એનો સુત બાપુ નામ જેહ<RHYME_208013>, થયો મંદ શરીરમાં તેહ<RHYME_208013>.
gujarati.context: As time passes, the world's attachment and desires vanish; what remains is a mere name, a legacy in one's weakened physical body.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને દેખીને તેની જનિતા, કરી અંતરમાં અતિ ચિંતા; 
મારે પુત્ર એક જ છે એહ<RHYME_208015>, કોઈ રીત્યે રહે એની દેહ<RHYME_208015>.
gujarati.context: When someone sees their own loved one, they are filled with overwhelming anxiety; my only son is unique and should stay in his body according to the natural order.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી તે સારુ સમરી દેવી, સુત સારુ અકળાણી એવી; 
નાવી દેવી આવ્યા અવિનાશ<RHYME_208017>, થયો કોટિ સૂર્યનો પ્રકાશ<RHYME_208017>.
gujarati.context: After a while, the beautiful morning comes; The infinite and endless light of the sun is revealed.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ તેજ તણો નહિ પાર<RHYME_208018>, ભેળા સંત હજારોહજાર<RHYME_208018>; 
પછી એમ બોલ્યા મહારાજ<RHYME_208019>, આવ્યા બાપુને તેડવા કાજ<RHYME_208019>.
gujarati.context: The couplet says that even a small amount of devotion is not comparable to the infinite merits of God, and thus one should focus on pleasing their parents instead. This is what a wise king would advise.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે તું કોટિ ઉપાય જો કરે, તોય તારો સુત ન ઊગરે; 
માટે ભૈરવ ભવાની ભૂત<RHYME_208021>, સમર્ય જે રાખે તારો સુત<RHYME_208021>.
gujarati.context:
Even if you make a thousand efforts, your reputation will not rise; but by being mindful of time, you can preserve it.
The Bhairava bhavana is the remembrance that preserves one's reputation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલી છે એમ તે બાઈ<RHYME_208022>, એનો ભાર નથી મારે કાંઈ<RHYME_208022>; 
પણ જીવ જનનીનો એવો, તેનો દોષ મને નવ્ય દેવો.
gujarati.context: The speaker's words are like a woman's promise, which is not burdensome; however, the fault of giving life and being born is always on my mind, as if it were a new god.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સુખે તેડી જાઓ મારો તન<RHYME_208024>, હું તો અતિશે છું પરસન<RHYME_208024>; 
એમ કહીને જોડીયા હાથ<RHYME_208025>, ત્યારે બોલ્યા હતા સંત સાથ<RHYME_208025>.
gujarati.context:
Go with happiness and my body, I am very tired to wait patiently; 
Together holding hands, the saints would then speak in that moment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મહારાજ એને એક બાળ<RHYME_208026>, તેને તેડી ન જાઉં દયાળ<RHYME_208026>; 
સંસારીને તો એટલું સુખ<RHYME_208027>, સુત વિત્ત વિના માને દુઃખ<RHYME_208027>.
gujarati.context: A great king's happiness is not in having many children, but in having enough to fulfill his desires without causing pain or sorrow. In this world, one finds peace and happiness with what they have, rather than longing for more.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે એમ બોલ્યા મહારાજ<RHYME_208019>, નહિ તેડી જાયે એને આજ<RHYME_208019>; 
એની પડોસણ્યનો જે તન<RHYME_208024>, તેને તેડી જાશું કહે જીવન<RHYME_208024>.
gujarati.context: The king said then, this life will not go; I will ensure its continuity, says the poem.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી તેહને તેડીને ચાલ્યા, બહુ લોકને દર્શન આલ્યાં; 
દીઠા સહુએ પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ<RHYME_208008>, થયું સત્સંગી કુસંગીને જાણ<RHYME_208008>.
gujarati.context: After having passed by with pomp, many saw them; having been recognized with a prominent reputation. He has become familiar and close friends through his sat-sangi (spiritual) companions.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ પ્રકટ પરચો દઈ<RHYME_208028>, ચાલ્યા બીજા બાળકને લઈ<RHYME_208028>; 
નહિ છાનું એ પ્રકટ જાણો, કહે પર્ચો થયો એ પ્રમાણો.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

When a father loses his child, he should let go and not hold onto memories; only then will he realize that the child has gone and that's the reality.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે નાનો જોડી જુગ હાથ<RHYME_208025>, ધન્ય ધન્ય દીનબંધુ નાથ<RHYME_208025>; 
તમે દયાનિધિ છો દયાળ<RHYME_208026>, દીનાનાથ દીનપ્રતિપાળ<RHYME_208026>.
gujarati.context: A small bond of love holds hands together, grateful and grateful in their poverty-stricken state. You are a treasure to cherish, a true friend who repays kindness with kindness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી વાત કહું એક સારી, હરિજનને છે હિતકારી; 
એક દ્વિજ બાપુ સરવરિયો, તેણે સમજીને સત્સંગ કરિયો.
gujarati.context: I tell a good story, beneficial to the lowly; a wise father-in-law instructed and guided him wisely.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જોઈ સાચી રીત સંત તણી, આવી પ્રતીત પોતાને ઘણી; 
વળી સાંભળી સંતની વાત<RHYME_208009>, તેને ભાંગી છે મનની ભ્રાંત<RHYME_208009>.
gujarati.context: The true path is followed by a saint, and one's own fate is determined; the words of a sage are listened to with reverence, but they pierce the heart like a sharp arrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
થયો સત્સંગી સ્વામીનો ખરો, બેપ્રવાઈ સિપાઈ આકરો; 
ઝાલી ટેક મુવે નવ મેલે, સિર કરમાં લઈને ખેલે.
gujarati.context: A true friend is one who stands by you through thick and thin, and together they share the joys and sorrows of life. True companionship is about embracing each other's ups and downs.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
નિષ્કપટ મતિ અતિ ઘણી, કહું વાત હવે તેહ તણી; 
એનો સુત તે રામસેવક<RHYME_208034>, થયો માંદો શરીરમાં છેક<RHYME_208034>.
gujarati.context: A true believer is extremely few, I'm now speaking the truth to you; Only a devotee of Rama's service remains in my weak and exhausted body.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યો સમો એને અંતકાળ<RHYME_208026>, ગરુડે ચડી પધાર્યા દયાળ<RHYME_208026>; 
સંગે સંત તણું બહુ વૃંદ<RHYME_208035>, મુક્તાનંદ સ્વામી નિત્યાનંદ<RHYME_208035>.
gujarati.context: The soul has reached the end of its journey, and with a pure heart, it has merged with the divine. In spiritual companionship, many are freed, and they rejoice in their daily bliss.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ગોપાળાનંદ સ્વામી છે સાથ<RHYME_208025>, જળ ઝારી ભરી ધરી હાથ<RHYME_208025>; 
નિત્યાનંદજી કરે ચમર<RHYME_208036>, એમ પધાર્યા શ્યામસુંદર<RHYME_208036>.
gujarati.context: Gopala and Shyamasundar are always together, their hands filled with water and support. They daily decorate the Lord's altar, just like Nitanandji.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠા સત્સંગી કુસંગી જને, આવ્યા બાપુભાઈને ભુવને; 
સહુ આવીને નામે છે શીશ<RHYME_208038>, કહે ભલે આવ્યા જગદીશ<RHYME_208038>.
gujarati.context: A true friend is found in shared sorrow or joy, and it's a blessing to have such companionship. True friends are a gift from God, and being with them is like being with one's own self.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે નાથ કહે આવ્યા આજ<RHYME_208019>, તારા સુતને તેડવા કાજ<RHYME_208019>; 
ત્યારે બાપુ કહે જોડી હાથ<RHYME_208025>, સુખે તેડી જાઓ મારા નાથ<RHYME_208025>.
gujarati.context:
When God says come today, don't hesitate; take my hand and go with joy.

Your parents say join hands, be happy and go with me, don't delay.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એના ભાગ્ય તણો નહિ પાર<RHYME_208018>, આવ્યા આ સમે પ્રાણઆધાર<RHYME_208018>; 
એવાં સુણી બાપુનાં વચન, કહે સાધુ સર્વે ધન્ય ધન્ય.
gujarati.context: Their destiny was not meant to be changed, they came to this world relying on their lives; such is the promise of fatherly words, all sages say thank you with gratitude.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંત જોડી કહે હાથ<RHYME_208025>, આજ મેલી જાઓ એને નાથ<RHYME_208025>; 
ત્યારે મહારાજ કહે ઘણું સારું, જાઓ માન્યું એ વચન તમારું.
gujarati.context: A saint advises to follow one's heart and not be bound by worldly expectations, saying "go with your intention" (આજ મેલી જાઓ એને નાથ). The king agrees, encouraging the individual to trust their own guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી દર્શન દઈ લોકને, ચાલ્યા બાપુનો ટાળી શોકને; 
દીઠા સહુએ પ્રકટ પ્રમાણો, થયો પર્ચો જન સહુ જાણો.
gujarati.context: After witnessing a calamity, the people mourned as if their father had passed away; they realized that the signs and warnings were evident, but they didn't pay attention.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહું એક દિવસની વળી, તેડી જમવા મુનિ મંડળી; 
જમ્યા મુનિ રાખી નહિ મણા, તોય વધ્યા છે મોદક ઘણા.
gujarati.context:
I'll summarize it in one to two lines:

One day, I gathered a group of monks for meditation; if they hadn't meditated and focused, many of my worries would have increased.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે બાપુ જમ્યા નહિ સંત<RHYME_208043>, માટે વધિયું અન્ન અત્યંત<RHYME_208043>; 
ત્યારે બોલ્યા છે ગોપાળસ્વામી, ભાઈ અમે રાખી નથી ખામી.
gujarati.context: A devotee's hunger is insatiable until they attain God's union, and thus they don't stop seeking spiritual nourishment. The Lord Gopala says that we should not neglect our devotional duties, my brother.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં વધ્યું હશે અન્ન<RHYME_208045>, જમશે કોઈ હરિના જન<RHYME_208045>; 
ત્યારે બાપુને આવ્યો વિશ્વાસ<RHYME_208046>, હમણાં આવશે કોઈ હરિદાસ<RHYME_208046>.
gujarati.context: When one does good deeds, one will surely reap the reward of food and wealth; God's grace is bound to come when we have faith in Him.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં આવ્યા જગદીશ<RHYME_208038>, સંગે સાંખ્ય યોગી દશવીસ; 
કહે હરિ હોય ત્યાર અન્ન<RHYME_208045>, છે આ ભૂખ્યા કરાવો ભોજન<RHYME_208045>.
gujarati.context: God has brought us to this world, and we have learned the art of yoga with our friends; then He says, "I am your food, and these hungry ones will feed on my feast."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બાપુએ જમાડ્યા તેહ<RHYME_208013>, કરીતી રૂડી રસોઈ જેહ<RHYME_208013>; 
હતા પાળા ને પ્રભુજી ક્યાંઈ<RHYME_208047>, જમ્યા અલૌકિક અંગે ત્યાંઈ<RHYME_208047>.
gujarati.context: After death, one's karma is taken care of, and the soul is made to drink the bitter medicine; God knows where it has been placed in accordance with its previous deeds.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ આપ્યો છે પરચો એહ<RHYME_208015>, વળી બીજો કહું સુણો તેહ<RHYME_208015>; 
આપી મૂરતિ મહારાજે એક<RHYME_208048>, પૂજી જળ લેવું આવી ટેક<RHYME_208048>.
gujarati.context: This couplet says that the current situation is a test, and one should think carefully before making another decision; just like a king's advisor should give good counsel after observing the king's mood.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને અર્થે લાવ્યો એક હાર<RHYME_208049>, ધર્યો મૂરતિને નિરધાર<RHYME_208049>; 
હાર હળવો જોઈ મૂરતિ, નાખ્યો ફગાવી અળગો અતિ.
gujarati.context: He gained a single loss, and gave up the opportunity; now the loss feels heavy, and he's left with regret.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બોલી છે મૂરતિ એમ<RHYME_208051>, હાર હળવો ચડાવે છે કેમ<RHYME_208051>; 
બીજે વાવરે છે બહુ ધન<RHYME_208052>, ત્યાં તો મોકળું રાખે છે મન<RHYME_208052>.
gujarati.context: Life speaks after mistakes, questioning why we fall; and in the midst of abundance, one should preserve gratitude within.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બાપુએ જોડ્યા છે હાથ<RHYME_208025>, એ તો ભૂલ્ય ઓળખાવી નાથ<RHYME_208025>; 
ધન્ય સામર્થિ તમારી સ્વામી, આજ પર્ચો પામ્યો હું બહુનામી.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી એક દને ગંગાબાઈ<RHYME_208022>, બેઠી માનસી પૂજાને માંઈ<RHYME_208054>; 
તિયાં કર્યોતો સુંદર થાળ<RHYME_208026>, આવ્યા પ્રકટ જમવા દયાળ<RHYME_208026>.
gujarati.context: One soul has surrendered to the divine, and with humility, offers their inner self in worship. The outcome is a beautiful creation, manifested by the divine's mercy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કરી દાતણ ને દીધી ચીરું, જમ્યા જીવનજી ધીરું ધીરું; 
પ્રભુ પ્રકટ જમિયા થાળ<RHYME_208026>, ચાલ્યા દર્શન દઈ દયાળ<RHYME_208026>.
gujarati.context: As you sow, so shall you reap; the Lord reveals everything in due time. The path of life will unfold as you walk it, with God's guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વધ્યાં ભોજન જમતાં જેહ<RHYME_208013>, આપી પ્રસાદી સહુને તેહ<RHYME_208013>; 
પામ્યા પ્રસાદી પ્રકટ સહુ, એવી વાત હું કેટલી કહું.
gujarati.context: As we enjoy our meals, we should share the blessings with others; sharing happiness is what I would like to say.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી એક દિને ગંગાબાઈ<RHYME_208022>, કહું દીઠું જે સમાધિ માંઇ; 
થયાં મહારાજનાં દરશન<RHYME_208056>, ભેળા દીઠા બહુ મુનિજન<RHYME_208045>.
gujarati.context: One day, I met Gangabai and told her my story in meditation; she showed me the path of great kings and many wise ones.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જાગી સમાધિ માંહિથી જ્યારે, લીધાં નામ સરવેનાં ત્યારે; 
જેને નાવડતું નામ એક<RHYME_208048>, તેણે લીધાં છે નામ અનેક<RHYME_208048>.
gujarati.context: When the soul is at peace, it remembers all its past names; but when one name is enough, it has many names to claim.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સહુ સાંભળી આશ્ચર્ય પામ્યા, ધન્ય મહારાજ કહી શીશ નામ્યાં; 
વળી એક દિવસની વાત<RHYME_208009>, સહુ સાંભળજ્યો તે સાક્ષાત<RHYME_208009>.
gujarati.context: Listen with wonder, Maharaaj's name was whispered in awe; a single day's tale is enough to become eternal fact.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એનો સુત તે રામસેવક<RHYME_208034>, ભણતોતો ગણપતિ અષ્ટક<RHYME_208034>; 
તેને મહારાજ સોંણામાં આવી, ગયા કૃષ્ણાષ્ટકને શિખાવી.
gujarati.context: The summary is: This child (or soul) is a devotee of Lord Rama and has learned the Ashtak (a hymn to Ganesha).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જાગી સવારે રામસેવક<RHYME_208034>, કહ્યા કંઠેથી અષ્ટ તે શ્લોક<RHYME_208034>; 
સહુ સાંભળી આશ્ચર્ય થયાં, ધન્ય નાથ કહે સર્વે રહ્યાં.
gujarati.context: After a good morning's prayer, the eighth shloka was said from the mouth; all were amazed and praised God as being present everywhere.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
મોટા સુભાગી એ નરનાર્ય, પામ્યા પર્ચા તે એમ અપાર<RHYME_208004>; 
ધન્ય ધન્ય પ્રભુનો પ્રતાપ<RHYME_208060>, આપ્યાં જનને સુખ અમાપ<RHYME_208060>.
gujarati.context: A great blessing is a couple who are grateful to God, and they will always enjoy happiness together.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે તો કહ્યે લખ્યે નાવે પાર<RHYME_208018>, કવિ બહુ બહુ કરે વિચાર<RHYME_208018>; 
જે જે આપ્યાં છે જનને સુખ<RHYME_208027>, કહ્યું જાતું નથી તે તો મુખ<RHYME_208027>.
gujarati.context: The poet's thoughts are overflowing like a river, and whatever they've thought is bringing joy to the people; their words are true and pure, without pretence or deceit.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 145: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanone Parachā Pūryā

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī shaher Vaḍodare, karī jannī jīvane sār; <RHYME_1>
Sambhaḷāvu sankṣhepshu, sahu suṇajyo nar-nārya.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: Life's journey in Vadodara city is short and precious; one should enjoy its moments with loved ones.

transliteration.couplet:
Sāmarthi potye Shrī Hari, āj vāvare chhe aparimīt; <RHYME_2>
Te kahī na jāy koīthī, chhe evī alaukik rīt.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: Divine power is limitless and boundless, beyond human comprehension. In this extraordinary era, even the impossible becomes possible.

transliteration.couplet:
Āge parachā pūriyā, jan hete laī avatār; <RHYME_3>
Paṇ eh thakī rītya ājanī, chhe jo aparampār.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The divine avatar is eager to arrive, prompted by the devotion of others. This is the tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahī kahī kahīe kyā lagī, ek jībhe jash apār; <RHYME_4>
Paṇ je āve mārī jāṇyamā, karu kāīk teno uchchār.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the sweetness of a loved one's words that can pierce like an arrow and leave a lasting impact. The speaker longs to hear such sweet nothings from their loved one, who has become distant.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek dvij bhakta chhe dakṣhaṇī, kahu vāt have teh taṇī; <RHYME_5>
Nārupant Nānā tenu nām, kare rāj-samājnu kām.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: A devoted brahmin ( Ek dvij bhakta ) is always mindful of his duties and has a pure soul; he brings honor to the community by doing good deeds.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā thayo satasang, chaḍyo chitte teno ati rang; <RHYME_6>
Vaḷī em samajyo sujāṇ, maḷyā Prabhu prakaṭ pramāṇ.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: In the gathering of saints, one's inner beauty shines bright; with the Lord's guidance, one's pride is brought down to its true form.

transliteration.couplet:
Rahī nahi udhārānī vāt, teṇe karī rahe raḷiyāt; <RHYME_7>
Sācho samajāṇo satasang, bhaje Shrī Hari karī umang.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: Despite life's uncertainties, the devotees of God remain enthusiastic and joyful. In the company of good people, one should cultivate devotion to God with pure enthusiasm.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe Swāmī Sahajānand satya, teh vinā to bīju asatya; <RHYME_8>
Evī antarmā gāṭhya pāḍī, ūkhaḍe nahi kenī ukhāḍī.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: The truth is self-evident and straightforward, without needing proof; it's the complexities within that require clarification.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā vītyā kāī dan, āvyu sansār sambandhī vighan; <RHYME_9>
Eno sut Bāpu nām jeh, thayo mand sharīrmā teh.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should not indulge in excessive charity or actions that harm the environment, as it can lead to chaos and entanglements in the world. Instead, focus on remembering Lord Krishna's name, which brings peace and salvation.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene dekhīne tenī janitā, karī antarmā ati chintā; <RHYME_10>
Māre putra ek ja chhe eh, koī rītye rahe enī deh.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that when we see others' pain, our own inner turmoil increases, and similarly, just as a mother's worry is always for her child, so too does the world's concern center around humanity itself.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī te sāru samarī devī, sut sāru akaḷāṇī evī; <RHYME_11>
Nāvī devī āvyā Avināsh, thayo koṭi sūryano prakāsh.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The goddess of the earth is gentle and merciful, yet stern towards those who cross her limits. She is eternal like the sun, which shines brightly in countless skies.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati tej taṇo nahi pār, bheḷā sant hajāro-hajār; <RHYME_12>
Pachhī em bolyā Mahārāj, āvyā Bāpune teḍavā kāj.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a situation where someone is unable to reach their goals or accomplishments, but they are content with being a humble saint among millions. The speaker then asks the Lord Mahārāj to grant them the task of playing the role of Bāpune, which implies surrendering one's ego and desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Te tu koṭi upāy jo kare, toy tāro sut na ūgare; <RHYME_13>
Māṭe bhairav bhavānī bhūt, samarya je rākhe tāro sut.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: One who practices a thousand remedies may not be able to cure the thread of fate; only the divine can protect and preserve it.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre bolī chhe em te bāī, eno bhār nathī māre kāī; <RHYME_14>
Paṇ jīv jananīno evo, teno doṣh mane navya devo.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The couplet conveys the idea that when a person dies, their words and actions come back to haunt them, like a heavy burden that they can't escape from. Meanwhile, the living must bear the new responsibility of carrying on the deceased's good or bad deeds.

transliteration.couplet:
Sukhe teḍī jāo māro tan, hu to atishe chhu parasan; <RHYME_15>
Em kahīne joḍīyā hāth, tyāre bolyā hatā sant sāth.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: Go to someone else's place if you are not invited, for I am burning with passion at home; and if you have taken hold of someone's hand, then speak softly and walk with the saintly companion.

transliteration.couplet:
Mahārāj ene ek bāḷ, tene teḍī na jāu dayāḷ; <RHYME_16>
Sansārīne to eṭalu sukh, sut vitta vinā māne dukh.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: A great king's wealth is not measured by his property or belongings, but by the goodness he shows to others; and in this world, happiness comes from giving, not receiving.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre em bolyā Mahārāj, nahi teḍī jāye ene āj; <RHYME_17>
Enī paḍosaṇyano je tan, tene teḍī jāshu kahe jīvan.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context:
The summary is:

Someone's life has reached the peak like a Maharaj, and it will not go beyond this; The soul that has attained the state of spiritual realization will tell you about life.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī tehane teḍīne chālyā, bahu lokne darshan ālyā; <RHYME_18>
Dīṭhā sahue prakaṭ pramāṇ, thayu satsangī kusangīne jāṇ.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

One takes a step forward, meeting many people; another steps into self-realization through spiritual gatherings and discussions.

transliteration.couplet:
Em prakaṭ paracho daī, chālyā bījā bāḷakne laī; <RHYME_19>
Nahi chhānu e prakaṭ jāṇo, kahe parcho thayo e pramāṇo.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: A treasure is hidden in plain sight, but it takes effort to recognize and extract its value. Without understanding the context, one cannot truly know the value of something that is apparent.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe Nāno joḍī jug hāth, dhanya dhanya dīnbandhu Nāth; <RHYME_20>
Tame dayānidhi chho dayāḷ, Dīnānāth dīn-pratipāḷ.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The merciful Lord Krishna is always available to help those in need, being the compassionate friend of all devotees. He is the treasure trove of mercy and kindness.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī vāt kahu ek sārī, harijanne chhe hitkārī; <RHYME_21>
Ek dvij Bāpu saravariyo, teṇe samajīne satsang kariyo.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: A couple's love is like a breeze that only they know, and it's a beautiful thing to cherish. A wise guru named Dvij Bapu gathers people together for spiritual gatherings, spreading the importance of love and devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Joī sāchī rīt sant taṇī, āvī pratīt potāne ghaṇī; <RHYME_22>
Vaḷī sāmbhaḷī santnī vāt, tene bhāngī chhe mannī bhrānt.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: In a peaceful atmosphere, the soul is pure and calm like a still evening. The world's noise can't disturb it, as it remains focused on its inner goal.

transliteration.couplet:
Thayo satsangī Swāmīno kharo, bepravāī sipāī ākaro; <RHYME_23>
Zālī ṭek muve nav mele, sir karmā laīne khele.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The devotee's love for God is pure and true, like a river that flows endlessly without an end. Their soul plays with the Lord's deeds like a child at play.

transliteration.couplet:
Niṣhkapaṭ mati ati ghaṇī, kahu vāt have teh taṇī; <RHYME_24>
Eno sut te Rāmasevak, thayo māndo sharīrmā chhek.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: A person with a pure and clear mind is like a full moon, unblemished by worldly worries. Similarly, one who serves Lord Ram with devotion is free from the bonds of karma.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyo samo ene antakāḷ, Garuḍe chaḍī padhāryā dayāḷ; <RHYME_25>
Sange sant taṇu bahu vṛund, Muktānand Swāmī Nityānand.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: In this couplet, the speaker praises Muktānand Swāmi, a devotee of Lord Nityānand, for his compassionate and gentle nature, which is like the soft petals of the garuda tree.

transliteration.couplet:
Gopāḷānand Swāmī chhe sāth, jaḷ zārī bharī dharī hāth; <RHYME_26>
Nityānandjī kare chamar, em padhāryā Shyām-sundar.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The summary is: Lord Gopāḷānand Swāmī is by my side, holding a handful of jasmine flowers; He adorns me with the beauty of Lord Shyām.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīṭhā satsangī kusangī jane, āvyā Bāpubhāīne bhuvane; <RHYME_27>
Sahu āvīne nāme chhe shīsh, kahe bhale āvyā Jagadīsh.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context:
The humble and devout one understands the true nature of life, which is like a fleeting dream in this vast universe.

Their name is written on the palm of their hand by God, says the wise Jagadish.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Nāth kahe āvyā āj, tārā sutane teḍavā kāj; <RHYME_28>
Tyāre Bāpu kahe joḍī hāth, sukhe teḍī jāo mārā Nāth.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The couplet is saying that when one's time has come, the Lord takes away, and similarly, when one's work is over, one should go to the Lord without delay.

transliteration.couplet:
Enā bhāgya taṇo nahi pār, āvyā ā same prāṇ-ādhār; <RHYME_29>
Evā suṇī Bāpunā vachan, kahe sādhu sarve dhanya dhanya.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: This couplet says that one's fate is predetermined and cannot be changed, but one should still listen to the wise words of elders like Sadhus who are grateful for their blessings.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sant joḍī kahe hāth, āj melī jāo ene Nāth; <RHYME_30>
Tyāre Mahārāj kahe ghaṇu sāru, jāo mānyu e vachan tamāru.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The Lord says: "Come now, the time has come for you to go with me."

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī darshan daī lokne, chālyā Bāpuno ṭāḷī shokne; <RHYME_31>
Dīṭhā sahue prakaṭ pramāṇo, thayo parcho jan sahu jāṇo.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: Meeting the dear ones brings joy and happiness, while leaving them behind fills one with sorrow and longing.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahu ek divasnī vaḷī, teḍī jamavā muni manḍaḷī; <RHYME_32>
Jamyā muni rākhī nahi maṇā, toya vadhyā chhe modak ghaṇā.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: A person's thoughts are like a fleeting cloud that disappears after a day; their memories remain, just as a sweet dish remains in the mind.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe Bāpu jamyā nahi sant, māṭe vadhiyu anna atyant; <RHYME_33>
Tyāre bolyā chhe Gopāḷ Swāmī, bhāī ame rākhī nathī khāmī.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: Guru is not attainable through worldly attachments, but only through intense spiritual practice; He who is like Lord Krishna, my brother, keeps me from falling into ignorance.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā vadhyu hashe anna, jamashe koī Harinā jan; <RHYME_34>
Tyāre Bāpune āvyo vishvās, hamaṇā āvashe koī haridās.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context:
When a person is poor and hungry, they think of God; 
When one has wealth, they consider themselves the greatest.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā āvyā Jagadīsh, sange sānkhya yogī dash-vīs; <RHYME_35>
Kahe Hari hoy tyār anna, chhe ā bhūkhyā karāvo bhojan.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: Lord Jagadish is the master of the cosmic dance, with a count of ten fingers; He asks, "Why should I, who has nothing to eat, invite others to feast?"

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Bāpue jamāḍyā teh, karītī rūḍī rasoī jeh; <RHYME_36>
Hatā pāḷā ne Prabhujī kyāī, jamyā alaukik ange tyāī.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The devotee's soul is immersed in the divine love, like a drop of water merging with the ocean. The egoistic self is humbled before God, transcending worldly bounds.

transliteration.couplet:
Em āpyo chhe paracho eh, vaḷī bījo kahu suṇo teh; <RHYME_37>
Āpī mūrati Mahārāje ek, pūjī jaḷ levu āvī ṭek.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: It seems to be a conversation between two people: "Em" (one) and "Aap" (the other). The couplet suggests that when one is devoted to their guru, it's as if they are in the presence of God itself.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene arthe lāvyo ek hār, dharyo mūratine niradhār; <RHYME_38>
Hār haḷavo joī mūrati, nākhyo fagāvī aḷago ati.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: In one's lifetime, it's better to have one great failure than many small successes without purpose; one must risk and try to achieve their true identity.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī bolī chhe mūrati em, hār haḷavo chaḍāve chhe kem; <RHYME_39>
Bīje vāvare chhe bahu dhan, tyā to mokaḷu rākhe chhe man.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context:
The couplet speaks of a situation where someone is stuck in a difficult circumstance and may not be able to escape or overcome it.

One's wealth and prosperity are temporary, but one should keep their dignity and self-respect at all costs.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Bāpue joḍyā chhe hāth, e to bhūlya oḷakhāvī Nāth; <RHYME_40>
Dhanya sāmarthi tamārī Swāmī, āj parcho pāmyo hu bahunāmī.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: Summary: One's own father is the one who gives protection with his hands, and God is the protector of one's ability to be grateful; today, I will count my blessings from many sources.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī ek dane Gangābāī, beṭhī mānasī pūjāne māī; <RHYME_41>
Tiyā karyoto sundar thāḷ, āvyā prakaṭ jamavā dayāḷ.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: Gangabai worships her mind as a temple, and performs beautiful rituals; she has made her compassion visible to others through her actions.

transliteration.couplet:
Karī dātaṇ ne dīdhī chīru, jamyā jīvanjī dhīru dhīru; <RHYME_42>
Prabhu prakaṭ jamiyā thāḷ, chālyā darshan daī dayāḷ.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person who has gained wisdom through patience and perseverance, and is now worthy of the Lord's presence. The speaker seeks divine guidance and compassion in their journey.

transliteration.couplet:
Vadhyā bhojan jamatā jeh, āpī prasādī sahune teh; <RHYME_43>
Pāmyā prasādī prakaṭ sahu, evī vāt hu keṭalī kahu.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: When invited to a meal, one should eat with humility and gratitude, accepting the host's blessings. In return, one should also offer their own humble thanks for the gift of food.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī ek dine Gangābāī, kahu dīṭhu je samādhi māi; <RHYME_44>
Thayā Mahārājnā darashan, bheḷā dīṭhā bahu munijan.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: On a single day, Gangābāī can take one to spiritual ecstasy; even the great kings get a glimpse of it when they meditate deeply.

transliteration.couplet:
Jāgī samādhi māhithī jyāre, līdhā nām saravenā tyāre; <RHYME_45>
Jene nāvaḍtu nām ek, teṇe līdhā chhe nām anek.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: The wise and enlightened soul is in a state of self-realization, with many names forgotten. One name remains, the true identity, which is multiple in its essence.

transliteration.couplet:
Sahu sāmbhaḷī āshcharya pāmyā, dhanya Mahārāj kahī shīsh nāmyā; <RHYME_46>
Vaḷī ek divasnī vāt, sahu sāmbhaḷajyo te sākṣhāt.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: The surprising thing is that Sahu's grandson became a great king, and it's a wonder to behold. In just one day and night, the wind can turn someone into a Sahu-like person.

transliteration.couplet:
Eno sut te Rāmasevak, bhaṇatoto Gaṇapati aṣhṭak; <RHYME_47>
Tene Mahārāj soṇāmā āvī, gayā Kṛuṣhṇāṣhṭakane shikhāvī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The devotee of Lord Rama is like a servant of the village deity, constantly chanting prayers; the king of Maharaaj comes and takes the crown from his head, making him sing devotional songs with joy.

transliteration.couplet:
Jāgī savāre Rāmasevak, kahyā kanṭhethī aṣhṭ te shlok; <RHYME_48>
Sahu sāmbhaḷī āshcharya thayā, dhanya Nāth kahe sarve rahyā.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: In the presence of Lord Rama's devotee, even a single verse is enough to dispel all doubts; it is truly astonishing that God is present in every moment.

transliteration.couplet:
Moṭā subhāgī e nar-nārya, pāmyā parchā te em apār; <RHYME_49>
Dhanya dhanya Prabhuno pratāp, āpyā janane sukh amāp.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A fortunate man and woman are born with good karma, which they share with others;

transliteration.couplet:
Te to kahye lakhye nāve pār, kavi bahu bahu kare vichār; <RHYME_50>
Je je āpyā chhe janane sukh, kahyu jātu nathī te to mukh.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: The speaker says that the one who has transcended worldly concerns and has found inner peace is considered a fortunate one; it's not just in saying so that they have achieved this state.
